questions.Question: Which of the following was the winner of the Grammy Awards 2016 "Record of the Year"?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ed Sheeran won two Grammy Awards including Song of the Year for "Thinking Out Loud".

questions.solution: Solution:		Kendrick Lamar led the winners with five trophies, including Best Rap Album for 'To Pimp a Butterfly'.

questions.Question: Which actress has been awarded with 64th National film Awards 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		Surabhi Lakshmi was awarded awarded with 64th National film Awards 2017 for her brilliant performance in 'Minnaminungu'.

questions.Question: Who is the author of the book "I do what I do"?
questions.solution: Solution:		Raghuram G. Rajan is the author of the book "I do what I do". Raghuram G. Rajan is a professor of finance at the University of Chicago. He was the Governor of the Reserve Bank of India between 2013 and 2016 and also served as Vice-Chairman of the Board of the Bank for International Settlements.

questions.Question: In the 64th Miss Universe Competition, the winner Pia Alonzo Wurtzbach belongs to -
questions.solution: Solution:		Pia Alonzo Wurtzbach, formerly known professionally as Pia Romero, is a Filipino - German model, actress and beauty queen who was crowned Miss Universe 2015.

questions.Question: Who among the following Nobel laureates has recently announced to put his Nobel Medal under Auction?
questions.solution: Solution:		James Watson, one of the scientists credited with discovering the structure of DNA, recently became the first ever living Nobel laureate to put his medal for auction.

questions.Question: Who was awarded the first Rajiv Gandhi National Sadbhavana Award?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first Rajiv Gandhi National Sadbhavna award was conferred on Mother Teresa in 1992. The award was instituted by All India Congress Committee of the Indian National Congress Party in 1992 to commemorate the lasting contribution made by the former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi. It is given on 20 August, the birth anniversary of Rajiv Gandhi.

questions.Question: Film Pather Panchali was directed by -
questions.solution: Solution:		'Pather Panchali' (A Song of the Little Road) marked Satyajit Ray's debut as a director. This masterpiece from Ray is a social drama inspired by a famous novel of the same name, by Bibhutibhushan Bandyopadhyay.

questions.Question: The third Indian Council of Cultural Relations (ICCR) distinguished Indologist Award for the year 2017 was awarded to Japanese professor . . . . . . .
questions.solution: Solution:		President Ram Nath Kovind on 27 November 2017 conferred the 3rd ICCR Distinguished Indologist Award to Professor Hiroshi Marui of Japan for his exemplary contribution to Indology.

questions.solution: Solution:		The highest civilian award of India 'Bharat Ratna' has been awarded to only two foreigners so far. One of them is Nelson Mandela. The other is Abdul Ghaffar Khan.

questions.Question: The first recipient of Nehru Award was -
questions.solution: Solution:		Thant known honorifically as U Thant was a Burmese diplomat and the third secretary - general of the United Nations from 1961 to 1971. He was the first recipient of Nehru Award.

questions.Question: An Indian economist has won 'Balzan Prize 2017' for contribution of women in Indian agriculture. What is his name?

questions.Question: Which is the highest gallantry award in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		 The Param Vir Chakra (PVC) is India's highest military decoration awarded for the highest degree of valour or self - sacrifice in the presence of the enemy, similar to the British Victoria Cross, US Medal of Honor, Pakistani Nishan - e - Haider, or French Legion of Honour or Russian Cross of St. George.

questions.Question: Which state gives Mewar Award?
questions.solution: Solution:		Maharana Mewar Award is a State Award of Rajasthan. This award has been instituted to honour work of permanent value to those who consider it their duty, like the Diwan of Shree Eklingnath ji, to serve society through services in the field of education, literature, social services, philanthropy and character building activities.

questions.Question: Who is the first Asian Winner of Nobel Prize?
questions.solution: Solution:		Rabindranath Tagore is the first Asian Nobel Laureate in Literature in 1913.

questions.Question: Who was the first Indian to receive Nobel Prize in Literature?

questions.Question: 'Ashoka Chakra' is awarded for -
questions.optionA: acts of gallantry in the presence of enemy
questions.optionD: the most conspicuous bravery or self sacrifice on land, air or sea but not in the presence of the enemy
questions.solution: Solution:		'Ashoka Chakra' is awarded for most conspicuous bravery or some act of daring or act of valour or self - sacrifice otherwise than in the face of the enemy. The decoration may be awarded posthumously.

questions.Question: Who among the following is the recipient of the first Dayawati Modi Award for art, culture and education?

questions.Question: The Nobel Prize was first awarded in -
questions.solution: Solution:		On 10 December 1901 the first Nobel Prizes were awarded.

questions.Question: Who among the following own the Nobel prize for literature?

questions.solution: Solution:		Sonam Kapoor's 'Neerja' won the best Hindi feature film award.

questions.Question: Who has recently been awarded with Nobel Prize for peace in 2016?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Nobel Peace Prize 2016 was awarded to Juan Manuel Santos for his resolute efforts to bring the country's more than 50 year long civil war to an end.

questions.Question: Who is the recipient of Nobel Prize in literature in 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Nobel Prize in Literature 2017 was awarded to Kazuo Ishiguro who, in novels of great emotional force, has uncovered the abyss beneath our illusory sense of connection with the world.

questions.Question: Raghuvir Chaudhary, who was recently awarded Sahitya Akademi Puraskar, enriched the literature in :

questions.Question: 'Global 500' awards are given for the outstanding achievement in which of the following fields?
questions.solution: Solution:		'Global 500 Awards' are given for outstanding achievement in ​the Protection of environment. The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) established the Global 500 Roll of Honour.

questions.solution: Solution:		In 1999, Amartya Sen was awarded the Bharat Ratna, a year after his 1998 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences.

questions.Question:

2. It is the replacement of British Victoria Cross.
3. It can be awarded to civilians.

questions.solution: Solution:		'Param Vir Chakra' is the replacement of British Victoria Cross.

questions.Question: Which one of the following fiction was selected for Man Booker Prize, 2015?

questions.solution: Solution:		On 13 October, chair judge Michael Wood announced that Jamaican author Marlon James had won the 2015 Man Booker Prize for his novel 'A Brief History of Seven Killings'. This was the first time that a Jamaican born author won the prize.

questions.Question: Who among the following was chosen for the Dadasaheb Phalke Award for the year 2010?

questions.Question: Amongst the following who is the latest recipient of the 'Bharat Ratna' award?

questions.Question: In which year was Pulitzer Prize established?
questions.solution: Solution:		Pulitzer Prize was established in 1917 by provisions in the will of American publisher Joseph Pulitzer, and is administered by Columbia University in New York City. Prizes are awarded yearly in twenty - one categories.

questions.Question: Gandhi Peace Prize for the year 2000 was awarded to the former President of South Africa along with -

questions.Question: Who was honoured with Padma Shri Award 2018 in the field of Social Work from West Bengal?
questions.solution: Solution:		Shri Sudhanshu Biswas was honoured with Padma Shri Award 2018 in the field of Social Work from West Bengal. He set up as many as 18 charitable primary schools, an old - age home, a children's home and a free dispensary in the remote areas of the Sundarbans in West Bengal.

questions.Question: Which film has won the Best Short Film for India in the Los Angeles Film festival, 2018?

questions.Question: Grammy Award is given in the field of -

The Grammys, as they are commonly known, are meant to recognize spectacular work in the music industry.

questions.Question: Who among the following is the winner of the World Food Prize (year 2015)?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sir Fazle Hasan Abed is the winner of the World Food Prize (year 2015).

questions.Question: Which district achieved the first position as per 'Swachh Survekshan Grameen 2018'?

questions.solution: Solution:		Amit Kumar was not one of the recipients of Major Dhyan Chand Lifetime Achievement Award for the year 2016.

questions.Question: "Bharatiya Jnanpith" is an organization related to which of the following?
questions.solution: Solution:		Bharatiya Jnanpith a literary and research organization, based in New Delhi, India, was founded on 18 February 1944 by Sahu Shanti Prasad Jain.

questions.Question: Tagore Award for Cultural Harmony 2013 has been given to -
questions.solution: Solution:		Music conductor Zubin Mehta received the Tagore Award For Cultural Harmony for the year 2013 in recognition of his outstanding contribution to cultural harmony.

questions.Question: Who won the BCCI Lifetime Achievement Award for women at the BCCI Annual Awards held in Bengaluru in March 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		Shanta Rangaswamy won the BCCI Lifetime achievement award for Women at the BCCI Annual Awards held in Bengaluru in March 2017.

questions.Question: The first recipient of Rajiv Gandhi's 'Khel Ratna' award is -
questions.solution: Solution:		The first recipient of the Rajiv Gandhi's 'Khel Ratna' award was Chess Grandmaster Viswanathan Anand, who was honoured for the performance in the year 1991 – 92.

questions.Question: Pulitzer prize is awarded for outstanding work in the field of -
questions.solution: Solution:		Pulitzer Prize is a series of annual prizes awarded by Columbia University, New York City, for outstanding public service and achievement in American journalism, letters, and music.

questions.Question: Saraswathi Samman is given annually for outstanding contribution to -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Saraswati Samman is an annual award for outstanding prose or poetry literary works in any of the 22 languages of India listed in Schedule VIII of the Constitution of India.

questions.Question: Who among the following has received a Nobel Prize in literature 1953?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Nobel Prize in Literature 1953 was awarded to Sir Winston Leonard Spencer Churchill for his mastery of historical and biographical description as well as for brilliant oratory in defending exalted human values.

questions.Question: The Arjuna Awards were instituted in the year -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Arjuna Awards are given by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, government of India to recognize outstanding achievement in National sports. Instituted in 1961, the award carries a cash prize of Rs 500000, a bronze statue of Arjuna and a scroll.

questions.Question: Who is not amongst the winners of Nobel Prize 2016 for Chemistry?
questions.solution: Solution:		J. Michael Kosterlitz is not amongst the winners of Nobel Prize 2016 for Chemistry.

questions.Question: Miss World 2015 competition held in China was won by Mireia Lalaguna. She belongs to -
questions.solution: Solution:		Mireia Lalaguna Royo is a Spanish model, actress and beauty queen who was crowned Miss World 2015.

questions.Question: The Dronacharya Award is associated with -
questions.solution: Solution:		It is officially called the Dronacharya Award for Outstanding Coaches in Sports and Games, for coaches who help athletes achieve excellence over a period of four years.

questions.Question: Dronacharya Award is given in -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Dronacharya Award, officially known as Dronacharya Award for Outstanding Coaches in Sports and Games, is sports coaching honour of the Republic of India.

questions.Question: Name the spiritual leader who was honoured with a humanitarian award by a prominent Jewish human rights organisation for promoting human dignity, interfaith relations and tolerance among people.
questions.solution: Solution:		Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was honoured with a humanitarian award by a prominent Jewish human rights organisation for promoting human dignity, interfaith relations and tolerance among people.

questions.Question: The 'Cannes Award' is given for excellence in which field?
questions.solution: Solution:		The 'Cannes Award' is given for excellence in films.

questions.Question: The journalist who refused to accept 'Padma Bhushan' was?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Khushwant Singh (Journalist) returned his Padma Bhushan in protest against Operation Blue Star (1984). He was awarded Padma Vibhushan in 2007.

questions.Question: The Nobel peace prize is awarded in which city?
questions.solution: Solution:		As stipulated in the will of the Swedish born inventor and international industrialist Alfred Nobel, which was opened after his death in 1896, the Nobel Prizes in Physics, Chemistry, Physiology or Medicine and Literature are awarded in Stockholm, Sweden, while the Nobel Peace Prize is awarded in Oslo, Norway.

questions.Question: Arjuna Award is given for -
questions.solution: Solution:		Arjuna award is given for outstanding performance in sports and games. This was the highest honour for sportspersons before Khel Ratna came up in 1991.

questions.Question: Who among the following is not a recipient of the Bharatiya Jnanpith Award?
questions.solution: Solution:		M. F. Hussain is not a recipient of the Bharatiya Jnanpith Award.

questions.Question: Who is the recipient of Arjuna Award 2016 in the field of athletics?
questions.solution: Solution:		Lalita Babar is the recipient of Arjuna Award 2016 in the field of athletics.

questions.Question: Who has been awarded the Prem Bhatia Award for the year 2008?
questions.solution: Solution:		Nirupama Subramanian has been awarded the Prem Bhatia Award for the year 2008.

questions.Question: Which Indian model won the Miss World 2017 contest held in China?
questions.solution: Solution:		India's Manushi Chhillar won the coveted Miss World 2017 crown at a grand event in China, bringing to an end the country's dry spell of 17 years at the top pageant contest.

questions.Question: 'The Tin Drum' is work of which of the Nobel Laureate?
questions.solution: Solution:		Gunter Wilhelm Grass was a German novelist, poet, playwright, illustrator, graphic artist, sculptor, and recipient of the 1999 Nobel Prize in Literature. He is known for his work 'The Tin Drum'.

questions.Question: Who among the following is the 2017 Asian Award recipient for the outstanding achievement in Cinema?
questions.solution: Solution:		Om Puri is the 2017 Asian Award recipient for the outstanding achievement in Cinema.

questions.Question: 'Sanghmitra Kalita' has been honoured with which award recently?
questions.solution: Solution:		The correct answer is Pulitzer Award. Indian - American Sanghamitra Kalita, who was the then managing editor of Los Angeles Times, was part of the team that won the Pulitzer in the breaking news category in 2016.

questions.Question: Who of the following was honoured as 2014 World Food Prize Laureate?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sanjaya Rajaram, a wheat breeder who has spent his life developing more than 480 varieties of the staple crop, was awarded The World Food Prize among an international audience at the Iowa State Capitol in Des Moines.

questions.Question: The 28th Annual lata Mangeshkar Samman Alankaran 2013 was conferred to -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Madhya Pradesh government, in May 2013, conferred the 28th Annual Lata Mangeshkar Samman Alankaran 2013 on famous playback singer Hariharan.

questions.Question: Name the Indian origin boy in United Kingdom who became the youngest applicant in a decade to achieve the highest score in the Mensa IQ test, beating geniuses such as Albert Einstein and Stephen Hawking.
questions.solution: Solution:		Mehul Garg, 10 year old Indian origin boy scored more than Einstein and Hawking in Mensa IQ test.

questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Who has been conferred with first World Sanskrit Award?
questions.solution: Solution:		Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn of Thailand has been conferred the first 'World Sanskrit Award' for her contribution towards promotion of the language.

questions.Question: Which state has bagged the top spot at the country's most popular tourist destination among foreign and domestic tourists in 2016?
questions.solution: Solution:		Tamil Nadu has bagged the top spot as the country's most popular tourist destination among foreign and domestic tourists in 2016.

questions.Question: Who is the winner of the prestigious Man Booker Prize 2013?
questions.solution: Solution:		Eleanor Catton has won 2013 Man Booker Prize, Britain's most prestigious literary award, for her second novel, “The Luminaries.”

questions.Question: The UNSECO's  'Prix Jules Verne' prize has been given to which of the following serials of Doordarshan?

questions.Question: Who among the following is not a recipient of 'Dada Saheb Phalke' Award?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ramanand Sagar is not a recipient of 'Dada Saheb Phalke' Award.

questions.Question: Sharad Joshi Samman is awarded for -
questions.solution: Solution:		Madhya Pradesh government has instituted an award in memory of Sharad Joshi titled "Sharad Joshi Samman", given each year to individuals for outstanding achievement in the field of writing.

questions.Question: In 1901, Nobel Prize was not given for -
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1901, Nobel Prize was not given for Economics.

questions.Question: Which city has become the first Indian city to win 'Pierre Lenfant International Planning Excellence Award 2017' instituted by the American Planning Association?
questions.solution: Solution:		Bhubaneswar has become the first Indian city to win Pierre Lenfant International Planning excellence award 2017 for its town planning process.

questions.Question: Who was directly elected for the post of judge of the supreme court?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indu Malhotra was directly elected for the post of judge of the supreme court.

questions.Question: Dr. C.V. Raman was awarded Nobel Prize for his work connected with which of following phenomenon of Radiation?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Nobel Prize in Physics 1930 was awarded to Sir Chandrasekhara Venkata Raman for his work on the scattering of light and for the discovery of the effect named after him.

questions.Question: Which of the following cities is included in the batch of 9 new cities selected for the Smart City Mission in January, 2018?
questions.solution: Solution:		The nine cities include three from Uttar Pradesh – Moradabad, Bareilly and Saharanpur, Bihar Sharif (Bihar), Silvassa (Dadra and Nagar Havelli), Erode (Tamil Nadu), Daman and Diu, Itanagar (Arunachal Pradesh) and Kavaratti (Lakshadweep).

questions.Question: Who among the following has been awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature in 2014?
questions.solution: Solution:		Jean Patrick Modiano, generally known as Patrick Modiano, is a French novelist and recipient of the 2014 Nobel Prize in Literature.

questions.Question: Who among the following has been chosen 'Person of the year 2015' by Times magazine?
questions.solution: Solution:		Angela Dorothea Merkel is a German politician serving as Chancellor of Germany since 2005. She has been chosen 'Person of the year 2015' by Times magazine.

questions.Question: Nobel Prizes are distributed annually at -
questions.solution: Solution:		Except for the Peace Prize, the Nobel Prizes are presented in Stockholm, Sweden, at the annual Prize Award Ceremony on 10 December, the anniversary of Nobel's death.

questions.Question: Which of the following was the winner of the Grammy Awards 2016 "Song of the Year"?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ed Sheeran won two Grammy awards including song of the Year for "Thinking Out Loud".

questions.Question: Which one of the following States will host the Nobel Prize Series - India 2018 (Science Impacts Life) Exhibition?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Goa government executed a trilateral Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Department of Bio-Technology, Ministry of Science and Technology, Government of India (GoI) and Nobel Media, Sweden to hold the 'Nobel Prize Series'.

questions.Question: Kalidas Samman Award has been instituted by -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Kalidas Samman is a prestigious arts award presented annually by the government of Madhya Pradesh in India.

questions.Question: Who among the following won the Best Actor award at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne (IFFM) 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sushant Singh Rajput won the Best Actor award at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne (IFFM) 2017 for his performance in 'M S Dhoni: The Untold Story'.

questions.Question: In January 2018 which Indian was conferred with France's highest civilian award 'The Legion of Honour'?
questions.solution: Solution:		In January 2018 Soumitra Chatterjee was conferred with France's highest civilian award 'The Legion of Honour'.

questions.Question: Roshan Lal, who won the Guru Dronacharya Award for 2017, is associated with which stream of sport?
questions.solution: Solution:		Roshan Lal, who won the Guru Dronacharya Award for 2017, is associated with Wrestling.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is a Peacetime Gallantry Award?
questions.solution: Solution:		Peacetime Gallantry Awards recognize courage or self - sacrifice away from battlefield and include Ashok Chakra, Kirti Chakra and Shaurya Chakra which is first, second and third respectively in order of precedence; while Param Vir Chakra and Vir Chakra are Wartime Gallantry Awards and recognizes self - sacrifice at battlefield. Yudh Seva Medal is military decorations for service during wartime.

questions.Question: Who won the 'Outstanding Parliamentarian' Award for 2017 given by the Indian Parliamentary Group (IPG)?
questions.solution: Solution:		'Outstanding Parliamentarian' Award for 2017 was given to Bhartruhari Mahtab.

questions.Question: Who won the 2016 Sahitya Akademi Award for Hindi?
questions.solution: Solution:		Nasira Sharma won the 2016 Sahitya Akademi Award for Hindi for his novel 'Parijat'.

questions.Question: Indian first talkie film produced in 1931 was -
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian first talkie film produced in 1931 was Alam Ara.

questions.Question: Who among the following is/are the recipient/recipients of Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award, 2018?
questions.optionB: Saikhom Mirabai Chanu and Virat Kohli
questions.solution: Solution:		Saikhom Mirabai Chanu and Virat Kohli are the recipients of Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award, 2018.

questions.Question: Who has been awarded with Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna award in 2018 for weightlifting?
questions.solution: Solution:		Saikhom Mirabai Chanu was awarded with Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna award in 2018 for weightlifting.

questions.Question: On whose name is the highest award for services to the development of cinema given?
questions.solution: Solution:		Dadasaheb Phalke Award is India's highest award in cinema. It is given for the "outstanding contribution to the growth and development of Indian cinema.”

questions.Question: Which of the following famous financial journals of international repute confers 'Finance minister of the year' Award?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Tansen Samman has been instituted by the Government of?
questions.solution: Solution:		Instituted by the Government of Madhya Pradesh in 1980, Tansen award is presented every year for excellence in Hindustani classical music. It is presented during the Tansen Samaroh at Gwalior.

questions.Question: On whom did the U. S. President George W. Bush bestow, in 2002, the U.S.'s highest award for life time achievement in the field of scientific research?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The only Indian to win the Nobel prize in physics is -
questions.solution: Solution:		Dr. C. V. Raman is India's first and only physicist to win a Nobel Physics Prize in 1930 "for his work on the scattering of light and for the discovery of the effect named after him.

questions.Question: Who among the following is a winner of the Indira Gandhi Award for National integration?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Indira Gandhi Award for National Integration is a prestigious award accorded by the Indian National Congress, after former Prime Minister of India, Indira Gandhi. Aruna Asaf Ali is a winner of the Indira Gandhi Award for National integration.

questions.Question: The first black American to win the Nobel Prize for literature is -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Nobel Prize in Literature 1993 was awarded to Toni Morrison who is the first black American to win the Nobel Prize for literature.

questions.Question: Who among the following got the 'Bharat Ratna' award, before becoming the President of India?
questions.solution: Solution:		Zakir Hussain was the third president of India. Before becoming the President he won the Bharat Ratna Award in the year 1963.

questions.Question: Manav Seva Award has been instituted in the memory of -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Rajiv Gandhi Manav Seva Award is given for service to children. Under this Scheme, every year the National Selection Committee selects three individuals who are presented the award on August 20 (the birthday of Rajiv Gandhi).

questions.Question: Kalinga Award was instituted by -
questions.optionA: UNESCO for exceptional contribution of efforts to popularise science
questions.optionC: Jnanpith, a cultural literacy society for encouraging creative writing in modern languages
questions.optionD: Indian Adult Education Association for outstanding contribution of adult literacy in India
questions.solution: Solution:		The UNESCO Kalinga Prize for the Popularization of Science is UNESCO's oldest prize, created in 1951 following a donation from Mr Bijoyanand Patnaik, Founder and President of the Kalinga Foundation Trust in India.

questions.Question: Who among the following was awarded with Padma Shri 2017 in the field of 'Hockey'?
questions.solution: Solution:		P. R. Shreejesh was awarded with Padma Shri 2017 in the field of Hockey.

questions.Question: Who among the following was awarded with Padma Shri 2017 in the field of 'Culinary'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sanjeev Kapoor was awarded with Padma Shri 2017 in the field of 'Culinary'.

questions.Question: Who has won the 'Miss Universe 2016' title?
questions.solution: Solution:		Iris Mittenaere is a French model, television host, and beauty pageant titleholder who was crowned Miss Universe 2016.

questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Who won the Nobel Prize for Chemistry in 2017?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2017 is awarded to Jacques Dubochet, Joachim Frank and Richard Henderson for the development of cryo - electron microscopy, which both simplifies and improves the imaging of biomolecules. This method has moved biochemistry into a new era.

questions.Question: How many Nobel Prize awards are awarded each year?
questions.solution: Solution:		Since 1901, the Nobel Prize has been awarded in the fields of physics, chemistry, physiology or medicine, literature and peace, while a memorial prize in economic sciences was added in 1968.

questions.Question: In which year did Dada Saheb Phalke produce the first feature film?
questions.solution: Solution:		Dada Saheb Phalke produced the first feature film in 1913 named Raja Harishchandra.

questions.Question: The Arjuna Awards were instituted in the year -
questions.solution: Solution:		The Arjuna Awards are given by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, government of India to recognize outstanding achievement in National sports. Instituted in 1961, the award carries a cash prize of Rs 500,000, a bronze statue of Arjuna and a scroll.

questions.Question: In which year 'Bharat Ratna' India's highest civilian award was established and how many persons have been honoured with this award so far?
questions.solution: Solution:		Bharat Ratna was established in 1952 and 48 persons have been honoured with this award so far.

questions.Question:
Norman Borlaug won Nobel Peace Prize for his contribution in:
1. Development of high-yielding crops.
2. Modernization of irrigation infrastructure.
3. Introduction of synthetic fertilizers and pesticides.
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
questions.solution: Solution:		Norman Borlaug was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1970 in recognition of his contributions to world peace through increasing food supply. Later in his life, he helped apply these methods of increasing food production in Asia and Africa.

questions.Question: Narendra Kohli has been recently chosen for the award of . . . . . . . . . .
questions.solution: Solution:		Narendra Kohli won Vyas Samman, 2012.

questions.Question: The 'Cannes Award' is given for excellence in which of the following field?
questions.solution: Solution:		The 'Cannes Award' is given for excellence in Films.

questions.Question: Moortidevi Award is given annually in which of the following fields?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Moorti Devi Award is an annual literary award in India presented by the Bharatiya Jnanpith organization for a work which emphasizes Indian philosophy and culture.

questions.Question: Who was the first posthumous recipient of Bharat Ratna?
questions.solution: Solution:		The 1954 statutes did not allow posthumous awards, but this was subsequently modified in the January 1955 statute, and Lal Bahadur Shastri became the first recipient to be honoured posthumously in 1966.

questions.Question: Who among the following has been awarded the Officer of the Legion of Honour, the highest civilian distinction of the Government of France?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: 'Navanethem Pillay' has been honoured with which award?
questions.solution: Solution:		'Navanethem Pillay' has been honoured with 'The Legion of Honour'.

questions.Question: The Nobel Peace Prize is awarded in which city?
questions.solution: Solution:		As stipulated in the will of the Swedish born inventor and international industrialist Alfred Nobel, which was opened after his death in 1896, the Nobel Prizes in Physics, Chemistry, Physiology or Medicine and Literature are awarded in Stockholm, Sweden, while the Nobel Peace Prize is awarded in Oslo, Norway.

questions.Question: Magsaysay Award is given after Ramon Magsaysay. He was President of which nation?
questions.solution: Solution:		Magsaysay Award is named after Ramon Magsaysay, the third president of the Republic of the Philippines. Ramon Magsaysay died in air crash in 1957.

questions.Question: Who among the following is the winner of the Jnanpith Award for the year 2015?
questions.solution: Solution:		Raghuveer Chaudhari is a novelist, poet and critic from Gujarat, India. He won the Jnanpith Award for the year 2015.

questions.Question: Who has been conferred with the 2015 Jnanpith Award?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board
